content:
unctional treatment of conditionals is more controversial and faces prob-
lems that are instructive.



163
Conditionals
Conditionals have the form “If , then .” What goes in the first
blank of this pattern is called the antecedentof the conditional; what goes in
the second blank is called its consequent. Sometimes conditionals appear in
the indicative mood:
If it rains, then the crop will be saved.
Sometimes they occur in the subjunctive mood:
If it had rained, then the crop would have been sav
